Line 68: Line 68:
== Software ==
== Software ==
â
HTC have announced that the device will be upgradable to the 2.3 Gingerbread Android OS in Q2 2011.<ref name=GBUpgrade>{{cite web|url=http://news.softpedia.com/news/HTC-Android-2-3-for-Desire-Desire-HD-Desire-Z-Incredible-S-in-Spring-186457.shtml|accessdate=April 13, 2011|title=HTC: Android 2.3 for Desire, Desire HD, Desire Z, Incredible S in Spring|publisher=[[Softpedia]]}}</ref> The device was shipped with the second version of HTC's Sense, which includes [[satellite navigation]] software developed by [[TomTom]] using maps from [[Route66]] (30 day free trial included) and a digital bookstore from [[Kobo]] fully integrated into the system. For the UK release, the UK & Northern Ireland maps are pre-loaded onto the bundled 8 GB [[microSD]] card. The device is a part of the new generation of HTC phones that have a signed bootloader. As a consequence, the phone cannot be easily [[rooted]], and the user is denied administrative rights to the phone.<ref name=LockedBootloader>{{cite web|url= http://blog.gsmarena.com/htc-incredible-s-has-a-signed-bootloader-and-recovery-will-htc-phones-become-less-custom-rom-friendly/|accessdate=May 24, 2011|title=HTC Incredible S has a signed bootloader and recovery, will HTC phones become less custom ROM friendly?|publisher=[[gsmarena]]}}</ref> However, users have achieved root despite the signed bootloader.
+
HTC have announced that the device will be upgradable to the [[Android (operating system)|Android]] 2.3 "Gingerbread" in Q2 2011.<ref name=GBUpgrade>{{cite web|url=http://news.softpedia.com/news/HTC-Android-2-3-for-Desire-Desire-HD-Desire-Z-Incredible-S-in-Spring-186457.shtml|accessdate=April 13, 2011|title=HTC: Android 2.3 for Desire, Desire HD, Desire Z, Incredible S in Spring|publisher=[[Softpedia]]}}</ref> The device was shipped with the second version of HTC's Sense, which includes [[satellite navigation]] software developed by [[TomTom]] using maps from [[Route66]] (30 day free trial included) and a digital bookstore from [[Kobo]] fully integrated into the system. For the UK release, the UK & Northern Ireland maps are pre-loaded onto the bundled 8 GB [[microSD]] card. The device is a part of the new generation of HTC phones that have a signed bootloader. As a consequence, the phone cannot be easily [[rooted]], and the user is denied administrative rights to the phone.<ref name=LockedBootloader>{{cite web|url= http://blog.gsmarena.com/htc-incredible-s-has-a-signed-bootloader-and-recovery-will-htc-phones-become-less-custom-rom-friendly/|accessdate=May 24, 2011|title=HTC Incredible S has a signed bootloader and recovery, will HTC phones become less custom ROM friendly?|publisher=[[gsmarena]]}}</ref> However, users have achieved root despite the signed bootloader.
